definition[0]: to make someone feel admiration and respect
example[0]: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
example[1]: ‘He’s a lawyer?’ Mum looked suitably impressed  (=as impressed as you would expect).
example[2]: We were very impressed by the standard of work.
example[3]: One candidate in particular impressed us with her knowledge.
example[4]: I think the chief exec was favourably impressed by your presentation.
definition[1]: to make the importance of something clear to someone
example[5]: Father impressed on me the value of hard work.
definition[2]: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it
